dimes.measurements.nio.packet.header
Class TCPHeader

java.lang.Object
  dimes.measurements.nio.packet.header.Header
      dimes.measurements.nio.packet.header.TCPHeader

public class TCPHeader
extends Header

Author:
Udi Weinsberg

Field Summary
static byte IP_PROTOCOL_TCP
          The IP protocol value that indicates the data contains TCP information.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_ACK
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the acknowledgement field should be considered significant.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_FIN
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the FIN flag is set, indicating the connection is being closed.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_PSH
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the push flag is set.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_RST
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the reset flag is set, indicating the forceful destruction of a connection.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_SYN
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the SYN flag is set, indicating a new connection.
static byte TCP_FLAG_MASK_URG
          The bitmask that may be applied to the TCP flags to determine whether the urgent pointer field should be considered significant.

Constructor Detail

TCPHeader

public TCPHeader(int sourcePort,
                 int destinationPort,
                 int sequenceNumber,
                 int ackNumber,
                 int dataOffset,
                 int tcpFlags,
                 int window,
                 int checksum,
                 int urgentPointer,
                 byte[] optionBytes)
Creates a new TCP header with the provided information.

Parameters:
sourcePort - The source port for this TCP header.
destinationPort - The destination port for this TCP header.
sequenceNumber - The sequence number for this TCP header.
ackNumber - The acknowledgement number for this TCP header.
dataOffset - The data offset for this TCP header, measured in 32-bit words.
tcpFlags - The set of flags associated with this TCP header.
window - The window for this TCP header.
checksum - The checksum for this TCP header.
urgentPointer - The urgent pointer for this TCP header.
optionBytes - The raw data associated with any options in this TCP header.

TCPHeader

public TCPHeader()
Tcp header constructor

deserialize

public int deserialize(java.nio.ByteBuffer packetBuffer)
                throws DeserializeException
Decodes information in the provided byte array as a TCP header.

Specified by:
deserialize in class Header
Parameters:
packetBuffer - the buffer which holds the packet
Returns:
next header id ( usually payload = 0 )
Throws:
DeserializeException
See Also:
Header.deserialize(java.nio.ByteBuffer)

getSourcePort

public int getSourcePort()
Retrieves the source port for this TCP packet. The port will be encoded in the lower 16 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The source port for this TCP packet.

getDestinationPort

public int getDestinationPort()
Retrieves the destination port for this TCP packet. The port will be encoded in the lower 16 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The destination port for this TCP packet.

getSequenceNumber

public int getSequenceNumber()
Retrieves the sequence number for this TCP packet. The value will use all 32 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The sequence number for this TCP packet.

getAcknowledgementNumber

public int getAcknowledgementNumber()
Retrieves the acknowledgement number for this TCP packet. The value will use all 32 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The acknowledgement number for this TCP packet.

getDataOffset

public int getDataOffset()
Retrieves the data offset for this TCP header. The value will be encoded in the lower 4 bits of the provided value and will indicate the number of 32-bit words contained in the header.

Returns:
The data offset for this TCP header.

getHeaderLength

public int getHeaderLength()
Retrieves the length in bytes of this TCP header.

Specified by:
getHeaderLength in class Header
Returns:
The length in bytes of this TCP header.

getTCPFlags

public int getTCPFlags()
Retrieves the set of flags for this TCP header. The flags will be encoded in the lower 6 bits of the returned int value, and individual flags may be checked by ANDing them with the values of the TCP_FLAG_MASK_* constants.

Returns:
The set of flags for this TCP header.

getWindow

public int getWindow()
Retrieves the window for this TCP header. The value will be encoded in the lower 16 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The window for this TCP header.

getChecksum

public int getChecksum()
Retrieves the checksum for this TCP header. The value will be encoded in the lower 16 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The checksum for this TCP header.

getUrgentPointer

public int getUrgentPointer()
Retrieves the urgent pointer for this TCP header. The window will be encoded in the lower 16 bits of the returned int value.

Returns:
The urgent pointer for this TCP header.

getOptionBytes

public byte[] getOptionBytes()
Retrieves the data for any options associated with this TCP header.

Returns:
The data for any options associated with this TCP header.
